Package index

All functions

createFolders()
Compile folder list and create folders
findGDAL()
Search recursivly existing 'GDAL binaries' installation(s) at a given drive/mountpoint
findGRASS()
Returns attributes of valid 'GRASS GIS' installation(s) on the system.
findOTB()
Search recursivly existing 'Orfeo Toolbox' installation(s) at a given drive/mountpoint
findSAGA()
Search recursively existing 'SAGA GIS' installation(s) at a given drive/mount point
gvec2sf()
Converts from an existing `GRASS` environment an arbitrary vector dataset into a sf object
initProj()
Simple creation and reproduction of an efficient project environment
linkGDAL()
Locate and set up 'GDAL' API bindings
linkGRASS()
Locate and set up 'GRASS' API bindings
linkOTB()
Locate and describe 'Orfeo ToolBox' (OTB) API bindings
linkSAGA()
Identifies SAGA GIS Installations and returns linking Informations
loadEnvi()
Load data from rds format and associated yaml metadata file.
otb_args_spec()
Return normalized OTB parameter spec for an application
otb_build_cmd()
Build a runOTB-compatible command template from OTB application metadata
otb_capabilities()
Retrieve OTB application capabilities (help text + parsed parameters)
otb_optional()
Get optional parameters for an OTB application (keys + defaults optional)
otb_required()
OTB-required parameter keys for an application
otb_required_with_output()
Required parameter keys under link2GI output policy
otb_set_out()
Set an OTB output parameter safely (file-based output)
otb_show()
Print a quick console view of an OTB application's parameters
parseOTBAlgorithms()
Retrieve available OTB applications
parseOTBFunction()
Retrieve the argument list from an OTB application
runOTB()
Execute an OTB application
saveEnvi()
Saves data in rds format and adds a yaml metadata file.
setupProj()
Setup project folder structure
setup_default()
Define working environment default settings
sf2gvec()
Write sf object directly to `GRASS` vector utilising an existing or creating a new GRASS environment

Developed by Chris Reudenbach.

Site built with pkgdown 2.2.0.
